channel.title: Adding new Items/Npcs [EASY TO FIX BRAINFART]
channel.description: Ok im just wondering how to add the correct coloring in a custom item.. Like right now its turning to Rune?

item.title: Adding new Items/Npcs [EASY TO FIX BRAINFART]
item.dc:creator: @yong_min yong min
item.description:
@yong_min wrote:

[quote=“Motaro, post:12, topic:358426”]It’s in animations.rscd…

Look at party hats for example:

    <name>partyhat</name>
    <charColour>16711680</charColour>
    <genderModel>0</genderModel>
    <hasA>true</hasA>
    <hasF>false</hasF>
    <number>0</number>
  </AnimationDef>
  <AnimationDef>
    <name>partyhat</name>
    <charColour>16776960</charColour>
    <genderModel>0</genderModel>
    <hasA>true</hasA>
    <hasF>false</hasF>
    <number>0</number>
  </AnimationDef>
  <AnimationDef>
    <name>partyhat</name>
    <charColour>255</charColour>
    <genderModel>0</genderModel>
    <hasA>true</hasA>
    <hasF>false</hasF>
    <number>0</number>
  </AnimationDef>
  <AnimationDef>
    <name>partyhat</name>
    <charColour>65280</charColour>
    <genderModel>0</genderModel>
    <hasA>true</hasA>
    <hasF>false</hasF>
    <number>0</number>
  </AnimationDef>
  <AnimationDef>
    <name>partyhat</name>
    <charColour>16711935</charColour>
    <genderModel>0</genderModel>
    <hasA>true</hasA>
    <hasF>false</hasF>
    <number>0</number>
  </AnimationDef>
  <AnimationDef>
    <name>partyhat</name>
    <charColour>16777215</charColour>
    <genderModel>0</genderModel>
    <hasA>true</hasA>
    <hasF>false</hasF>
    <number>0</number>
  </AnimationDef>

Edit the

In order for it to work that way the sprites must be white/gray without any colors.

So you can’t take a blue sprite and change the color to green, you’ll need a white sprite and change the color to green.[/quote]

You’re also forgetting from ItemWieldableDef.XML.

Read full topic
item.source: Adding new Items/Npcs [EASY TO FIX BRAINFART]

item.title: Adding new Items/Npcs [EASY TO FIX BRAINFART]
item.dc:creator: @Motaro Motaro
item.description:
@Motaro wrote:

It’s in animations.rscd…

Look at party hats for example:

    <name>partyhat</name>
    <charColour>16711680</charColour>
    <genderModel>0</genderModel>
    <hasA>true</hasA>
    <hasF>false</hasF>
    <number>0</number>
  </AnimationDef>
  <AnimationDef>
    <name>partyhat</name>
    <charColour>16776960</charColour>
    <genderModel>0</genderModel>
    <hasA>true</hasA>
    <hasF>false</hasF>
    <number>0</number>
  </AnimationDef>
  <AnimationDef>
    <name>partyhat</name>
    <charColour>255</charColour>
    <genderModel>0</genderModel>
    <hasA>true</hasA>
    <hasF>false</hasF>
    <number>0</number>
  </AnimationDef>
  <AnimationDef>
    <name>partyhat</name>
    <charColour>65280</charColour>
    <genderModel>0</genderModel>
    <hasA>true</hasA>
    <hasF>false</hasF>
    <number>0</number>
  </AnimationDef>
  <AnimationDef>
    <name>partyhat</name>
    <charColour>16711935</charColour>
    <genderModel>0</genderModel>
    <hasA>true</hasA>
    <hasF>false</hasF>
    <number>0</number>
  </AnimationDef>
  <AnimationDef>
    <name>partyhat</name>
    <charColour>16777215</charColour>
    <genderModel>0</genderModel>
    <hasA>true</hasA>
    <hasF>false</hasF>
    <number>0</number>
  </AnimationDef>

Edit the

In order for it to work that way the sprites must be white/gray without any colors.

So you can’t take a blue sprite and change the color to green, you’ll need a white sprite and change the color to green.

Read full topic

@Jython wrote:

in config.jag there are two color masking values per item… one is for masking grays and the other for masking pinks
